skill.name: github-multi-repo
skill.description: Multi-repository coordination, synchronization, and architecture management with AI swarm orchestration
skill.summary: Multi-repository coordination, synchronization, and architecture management with AI swarm orchestrat...
skill.author: Claude Flow Team

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. All operations delegate to external tools (gh CLI, claude-flow MCP) that users explicitly invoke. No file access, network calls, or command execution without user authorization.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple GitHub repositories requires coordinating changes, dependencies, and releases across repositories. This skill uses AI swarm orchestration to synchronize packages, standardize architecture, and coordinate cross-repository operations automatically.
actual_capabilities: Coordinate changes across multiple GitHub repositories using AI swarm orchestration
Synchronize package versions and dependencies across repositories
Analyze and optimize repository architecture with automated templates
Create standardized project templates for new repositories
Deploy security patches and dependency updates across all repositories
Generate cross-repository dependency graphs and health reports
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) and claude-flow MCP server installation
Cannot access private repositories without proper gh authentication
Operates on repositories you have explicit access to via gh CLI
Swarm operations depend on available MCP server resources

use_cases.title: Synchronize microservices
use_cases.description: Keep shared libraries and API contracts consistent across all microservices in your organization

use_cases.title: Coordinate cross-repo releases
use_cases.description: Deploy coordinated releases across multiple repositories with synchronized version bumps

use_cases.title: Deploy security patches
use_cases.description: Apply security updates to all repositories and create automated pull requests

best_practices: Use hierarchical topology for clear ownership and mesh for peer-to-peer coordination
Create tracking issues before organization-wide changes to monitor progress
Test changes in a single repository before propagating across all repositories
anti_patterns: Running swarm operations without specifying repository boundaries
Applying strong consistency sync for documentation changes
Ignoring failed tests in individual repositories before propagating changes

faq.question: What permissions does this skill need?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI authentication for repos you access. No additional permissions beyond gh CLI.

faq.question: How many repositories can this skill coordinate?
faq.answer: Scales to hundreds of repositories. Adjust maxAgents based on system resources.

faq.question: Can I use this with private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, if gh CLI is authenticated and you have access to those repositories.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: All operations are explicit via gh CLI. No hidden data collection or external calls.

faq.question: What sync strategies are available?
faq.answer: Eventual consistency for documentation, strong consistency for security updates, hybrid for mixed workloads.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual coordination?
faq.answer: Automates repetitive tasks across repos. Reduces errors and ensures consistency compared to manual approaches.
